body:
Dear Chris,



I have a small problem when I was using the Microclimate map example file. Following the guidance, I copied the zip file URL to my clipboard and connected to the 'weatherFileURL'. But with an error pop-out: WeatherFileURL is not a valid web address to a DOE weather file.



Is this because the DOE's website changed? 

[http://apps1.eere.energy.gov/buildings/energyplus/weatherdata_about...](http://apps1.eere.energy.gov/buildings/energyplus/weatherdata_about.cfm)

[https://www.energyplus.net/weather](https://www.energyplus.net/weather)



Thanks in advance!!

replies.body:
Hi Maria,

You are right. Check this post: [http://www.grasshopper3d.com/group/ladybug/forum/topics/changed-loc...](http://www.grasshopper3d.com/group/ladybug/forum/topics/changed-location-of-the-department-of-energy-weather-file)

You probably need to update the link which you can find it on epwmap ([http://mostapharoudsari.github.io/epwmap/](http://mostapharoudsari.github.io/epwmap/))

Dear Mostapha, Thanks for your help!!!!!! I have tried 2 options but both of them couldn’t work. 1)     As Chris said, updating the weather file link cannot work correctly. The error is the same as what I have posted yesterday: WeatherFileURL is not a valid web address to a DOE weather file. 2)     I used the downloaded weather file. The remaining problem is that when I was trying to run the Microclimate Map, there is a component named ‘Ladybug_Import_Stat’ which requires me to feed in ‘Statfile’. I have checked all the related ‘import weather file’ component, but cannot find a specific component to open StatFile.  [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/088*6UBF7TCl2TQhMA08ekHRYUbsbCX*8LObwOYAWewsrm2fXZSUP*v8KtUtevaZC68bloWGj3157mcaS14OHwDGr9V80oZW/1.png) I tried to link ‘Open EPW’ component to ‘Ladybug_Import_Stat’ , but it seems didn’t work (see as below). The pop-out error showed: ‘Solution exception: index out of range:1’. What's wrong with my operation? [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/088*6UBF7TBLV49hmdB7pSHFaxHVWSXxIGYGopeQdyTzE7SdYY2j5H2Y1467Egcb-ZqCKi6v31ac0s9-MmMUaFVJDRnOL2Nw/2.png)

2. Check under 0|Ladybug for "Ladybug_Open STAT File". You can also use Grasshopper's File Path component.

3. As far as I can see you're connecting the wrong file to ImportStat component that might be the reason. If connecting the stat file didn't solve the issue open a new discussion for the problem so Chris or someone else on the group can help you with your problem.

Dear Mostapha,



Thank you very much!!!!!!!!!!! I didn't find 'Ladybug_Open STAT File' myself previously and thus thought there was no component could open the STAT file. It worked now. :)
